content.p: eTools.ch is a fast meta search engine developed in Switzerland that uses bits of infrastructure and the commercial version of the Lingo algorithm to group search results by topic.
JobVille is an Italian job search engine based on Apache Solr. JobVille uses and its Lingo clustering algorithm to generate search suggestions and similar profiles.
EB-eye Search engine at the European Bioinformatics Institute uses to aid exploration of the returned search results.

Shumbi Discover is a next generation research tool using deep-web discovery, visual search and annotation. Shumbi embeds the .NET version of Lingo clustering algorithm to offer on-the-fly fully automatic grouping of search results.
Apache Solr is an open source enterprise search server based on the Lucene Java search library. Solr offers out-of-the-box search results clustering feature based on algorithms.

Constellio is an open source enterprise search that lets you find all your organization's relevant content (Web, Email, ECM, CRM, Databases, etc.) with a single click. Constellio offers -powered search results clustering.
InQuira uses algorithms in their knowledge management products.

SearchBlox is a high-performance Content Search Software designed for corporate intranets, websites, portals and custom-applications, which offers -powered clustered search results presentation as an option.
Apache Nutch is open source web-search software that features a clustering plugin powered by Carrot2's Lingo algorithm.
gceel.com uses to provide a A New Visual Search Interface for Web Browsing.
Struly is a multi search engine that embeds as one of the search sources.
Focuseek used algorithms to add the dynamic clustering feature to their enterprise search software called Nautilus.
